▣ FBI: Most Wanted Drama 10p

Fulfilling the TV axiom that says every Dick Wolf series gets a spinoff, Most Wanted first debuted as a backdoor pilot on the April 2nd episode of Wolf's FBI. The spinoff will center on the FBI division charged with tracking down the criminals on the Bureau's "most wanted" list (in case that show title didn't make this crystal clear already). Julian McMahon, Kellan Lutz, Nathaniel Arcand, Roxy Sternberg, and Keisha Castle-Hughes star. (Alana De La Garza was originally set to move from the main series to Most Wanted but will now remain where she is on FBI, though she will guest occasionally on the new show.)

Gordon Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back Reality 9p

The Haves and the Have Nots Drama OWN, 9p

Ink Master Reality competition Paramount, 10p

Jeopardy: The Greatest of All Time Game show 8p

Special multi-day tournament (which marks Jeopardy's first prime-time network television airing in over three decades) pits the game show's all-time winningest champions (James Holzhauer, Ken Jennings, and Brad Rutter) against each other. Subsequent episodes will air each night until someone wins a total of three matches.

mixed-ish Comedy 9p

NCIS Drama 8p

The Resident Drama 8p

Schitt's Creek Trailer Comedy Pop, 9p

Vanderpump Rules Reality Bravo, 9p

▣ Zoey's Extraordinary Playlist Drama 10p

[Special sneak preview tonight; the official debut is February 16.] The rare network show to start with a "Z" (joining such greats as Zorro and Son and Zoe, Duncan, Jack and Jane), Zoey is a magical realist drama from Austin Winsberg (Jake in Progress, The Sound of Music Live!) and producer Paul Feig. Jane Levy stars as a "whip-smart" San Francisco-based coder who suddenly gains the ability to hear the thoughts and desires of people around her through—wait for it—song. Is it a blessing? A curse? Well, that depends on how good the songs are. Lauren Graham, Skylar Astin, Mary Steenburgen, Peter Gallagher, Alex Newell, John Clarence Stewart, and Andrew Leeds fill out the cast.

WED / January 8

America's Top Dog Trailer Fureality competition A&E, 9p

Criminal Minds Drama 9p

Special two-hour premiere.

Modern Family Comedy 9p

Reboot of the 1990s series of the same name (which ran for six seasons on Fox) offers a timely take on the story of five children who must support each other after they lose their parents—in this case, because their parents are deported to Mexico. The first half of tonight's two-episode debut will also be available to stream one week early (on Jan. 1) via Freeform's app and website and Hulu.

Single Parents Comedy 9:30p

Stumptown Drama 10p

Undercover Boss Reality 8p

THU / January 9

Very Cavallari Reality E!, 9p

FRI / January 10

Co-created by Sex and the City's Michael Patrick King and Drag Race host RuPaul, this Netflix sitcom stars the latter as Ruby Red, a drag queen who takes on a 10-year-old runaway as a traveling companion while embarking on a cross-country trip in an attempt to open his own drag club.

Hopelessly in Love: Lisa “Left Eye” Lopes & Andre Rison Documentary Lifetime, 9p

▣ Lincoln Rhyme: Hunt for the Bone Collector Drama 8p

Russell Hornsby (of Grimm and the just-canceled Proven Innocent) heads the cast of this series adaptation of Jeffery Deaver's novel The Bone Collector, which was previously made into a not all that good 1999 film. He plays Lincoln Rhyme, a former forensic specialist with the NYPD who was forced to retire when an encounter with a serial killer left him paralyzed. But he is brought back in when a young detective (Arielle Kebbel of Midnight, Texas) has a lead on the same killer. Michael Imperioli, Brían F. O'Byrne, Brooke Lyons, and Tate Ellington also star. The adaptation comes from relative newcomer Mark Bianculli and former Justified writer/producer V.J. Boyd. Note that The Blacklist will go on a brief hiatus to make way for this newcomer, which runs until March.

The Owl House Trailer Animation/Family Disney, 8:45p

SUN / January 12

25th Annual Critics Choice Awards Live event 7p

The Outsider Trailer Drama/Horror 9p

HBO's 10-episode adaptation of Stephen King's 2018 horror novel stars Ben Mendelsohn as a detective investigating the brutal murder of an 11-year-old boy found in the Georgia woods. Jason Bateman, Cynthia Erivo, Bill Camp, Mare Winningham, Paddy Considine, and Julianne Nicholson also star. Two episodes air back-to-back tonight.

▣ Sanditon Trailer Drama 9p

Jane Austen's unfinished final novel set in a seaside village comes to the small screen in an adaptation from Andrew Davies (Les Misérables, Mr. Selfridge). Rose Williams, Theo James, Anne Reid, Kris Marshall, and Crystal Clarke star.

MON / January 13

The Good Doctor Drama 10p

Meet the Frasers Trailer Reality E!, 10p

Director Paolo Sorrentino's nine-episode sequel to his 2017 miniseries The Young Pope returns star Jude Law and finds John Malkovich's Sir John Brannox taking over the papal throne. Sharon Stone and Marilyn Manson guest, because why not.

WED / January 15

68 Whiskey Trailer Drama/Comedy Paramount, 10p

Think of it as a modern-day M*A*S*H. Adapted from an Israeli series (Charlie Golf One), this 10-episode dramedy focuses on a group of Army medics serving in Afghanistan. The ensemble cast includes Sam Keeley, Jeremy Tardy, Gage Golightly, and Cristina Rodlo.

Expedition With Steve Backshall Reality 10p

The Goldbergs Comedy 8p

▣ Seven Worlds, One Planet Documentary/Nature BBC America, 9p

The latest stunningly photographed nature series narrated by David Attenborough follows recent hits Planet Earth II and Blue Planet II. Shot across all seven continents, the seven-part series will be simulcast on Sundance, AMC, and IFC.

Stolen by My Mother: The Kamiyah Mobley Story Drama Lifetime, 8p

▣ 9-1-1: Lone Star Trailer Drama 10p ET / 7p PT

Rob Lowe and Liv Tyler head the cast of this 9-1-1 spinoff set in Austin, Texas. The special two-night premiere begins tonight immediately after the NFC Championship game (on both coasts) and concludes tomorrow at 8p.

A Million Little Things Drama 10p

▣ Outmatched Comedy 8:30p

Fox's lone new live-action sitcom this season comes from LA→Vegas creator Lon Zimmet and centers on a blue-collar couple (Jason Biggs, Maggie Lawson) living in South Jersey. Together, they are trying to raise four kids—three of whom are "certified geniuses," whatever that means.

Patrick Stewart returns as Starfleet's greatest captain (hey, we're just stating facts) in a new series that picks up over two decades after the events of Star Trek: The Next Generation and its various film spinoffs. Filling out the main cast are Michelle Hurd, Santiago Cabrera, Alison Pill, Isa Briones, and Harry Treadaway, but you'll also see some familiar faces from TNG (and Voyager), including Brent Spiner, Jonathan Frakes (who also directs several episodes), Marina Sirtis, and Jeri Ryan. Novelist Michael Chabon is among the writers and serves as showrunner for the 10-episode season, which is not a miniseries and could continue with additional seasons.

Station 19 Drama 8p

The cast from season one of Miracle Workers (including Daniel Ratcliffe and Steve Buscemi) returns, but all will be playing new characters in this second season that shifts the setting to the medieval era.

LEGO Masters Reality competition 9p

Brad Pitt-produced crafting competition (an adaptation of a UK series) finds 12 teams of two working exclusively in the medium of LEGO. Will Arnett hosts.

Summer House Reality Bravo, 9p

THU / February 6

Brooklyn Nine-Nine Comedy 8p

Special one-hour season premiere; subsequent episodes will air at 8:30p on Thursdays.

Carol's Second Act Comedy 9:30p

▣ Indebted Comedy 9:30p

This single-camera full-house comedy stars Adam Pally and Abby Elliott as a young married couple raising a pair of kids. Suddenly, they find themselves forced to take in his parents (Fran Drescher and Steven Weber) after they run into major debt problems. The series comes from The Goldbergs and Mulaney writer Dan Levy.

▣ Katy Keene Trailer Drama 8p

The CW's final newcomer this season is a Greg Berlanti-produced spinoff from Riverdale focusing on four twentysomethings pursing fame in New York City. Pretty Little Liars' Lucy Hale stars as the title character, an aspiring fashion designer who befriends Riverdale character and would-be singer-songwriter Josie McCoy (Ashleigh Murray, who is leaving Riverdale as a result). Jonny Beauchamp and Julia Chan play the other two young artists in their orbit. Expect Katy Keene to have a much lighter tone than its sister show—and, since Keene takes place about five years after Riverdale, don't expect any crossovers between the two shows (though producers aren't ruling out showing glimpses of one or more Riverdale characters as they would appear five years later).

Mom Comedy 9p

▣ Tommy Trailer Drama 10p

The latest CBS crime procedural stars Edie Falco as a New York cop who moves to the opposite (and, objectively, better) coast to become the LAPD's first female chief of police. The series comes from Paul Attanasio (Bull, Homicide: Life on the Street) and also stars Michael Chernus, Thomas Sadoski, and Adelaide Clemens.

The Unicorn Comedy 8:30p

Young Sheldon Comedy 8p

Blue Bloods Drama 10p

▣ Homeland Drama 9p

▣ Kidding Trailer Comedy 10p

MON / February 11

For Life Drama 10p

This 50 Cent-produced drama is inspired by the true story of Isaac Wright, Jr., a wrongfully convicted drug kingpin who was eventually exonerated and became a lawyer, ultimately arguing cases in the same court where he was given a life sentence. Created by Hank Steinberg (The Last Ship), the show begins with its protagonist (Nicholas Pinnock) still in prison. Indira Varma, Mary Stuart Masterson, Glenn Fleshler, and Dorian Missick also star.

WED / February 12

Survivor Reality competition 8p

Special two-hour premiere.

To All the Boys: P.S. I Still Love You Drama

FRI / February 14

Cable Girls Foreign/Drama

Originally ordered for Disney+ but moved to the older-skewing Hulu, this series adaptation of the Nick Hornby novel (previously adapted into a 2000 feature film by Stephen Frears) stars Zoe Kravitz as a gender-reversed version of the book's main character, an obsessive record store owner who revisits five of her exes on a quest for self-improvement. Jake Lacy, Da'Vine Joy Randolph, and David H. Holmes also star. All 10 episodes stream today.

SAT / February 15

You Can't Take My Daughter Drama Lifetime, 8p

SUN / February 16

American Idol Reality competition 8p

Taking over for Bless the Harts for the remainder of the current season is another new animated comedy, this one from the Parks and Recreation team of Amy Poehler and Mike Scully (along with Julie Thacker Scully, who has worked on The Simpsons). It follows the adventures of a "spectacularly average" 15-year-old boy named Duncan, voiced by Poehler. Rashida Jones, Ty Burrell, and Wiz Khalifa fill out the main voice cast, while the animation comes from Bento Box, the studio behind Fox's Bob’s Burgers.

Extreme Makeover: Home Edition Reality HGTV, 9p

Jesse Tyler Ferguson hosts a reboot of the feel-good reality series that previously aired on ABC from 2003-2012.

God Friended Me Drama 8p

Good Girls Drama 10p

▣ The Good Lord Bird Drama 10p

Albert Hughes (replacing Anthony Hemingway, who left the project due to scheduling conflicts) directs this eight-episode adaptation of the award-winning novel by James McBride about 19th century abolitionist John Brown, played by Ethan Hawke. Daveed Diggs (playing Frederick Douglass), Lodge 49's Wyatt Russell, David Morse, Steve Zahn, Orlando Jones, and Ellar Coltrane also star.

NCIS Los Angeles Drama 9p

NCIS New Orleans Drama 10p

Moves to a new time period.

▣ Outlander Trailer Drama Starz, tbd

Slow Burn Documentary Epix, 10p

Six-part series is an adaptation of the first season of Slate's podcast of the same name, which explores the Watergate scandal.

War of the Worlds Drama/Sci-fi Epix, 9p

This eight-part adaptation of H.G. Wells's classic tale of alien invasion transports the story to present-day Europe (and features aliens from another galaxy rather than Mars). Gabriel Byrne, Elizabeth McGovern, Léa Drucker, and Natasha Little head the cast.

▣ Zoey's Extraordinary Playlist Drama 9p

The rare network show to start with a "Z," Zoey is a magical realist drama from Austin Winsberg (Jake in Progress, The Sound of Music Live!) and producer Paul Feig. Jane Levy stars as a "whip-smart" San Francisco-based coder who suddenly gains the ability to hear the thoughts and desires of people around her through—wait for it—song. Is it a blessing? A curse? Well, that depends on how good the songs are. Lauren Graham, Skylar Astin, Mary Steenburgen, Peter Gallagher, Alex Newell, John Clarence Stewart, and Andrew Leeds fill out the cast.

WED / February 19

▣ Year of the Rabbit Comedy IFC, 10:30p

This six-episode British comedy series from comedian and What We Do in the Shadows star Matt Berry (Toast of London) finds him playing a police detective in Victorian-era London.

SUN / February 23

▣ Better Call Saul Drama 10p

Subsequent episodes will air Mondays at 9p, beginning tomorrow night.

The Rookie Drama 10p

▣ The Walking Dead Drama/Horror 9p

▣ Cosmos: Possible Worlds Documentary Nat Geo, tbd

Delayed follow-up to the 2014 Cosmos reboot is again hosted by Neil deGrasse Tyson. The series will also air on Fox during the summer, in case you don't have the energy to try to figure out where Nat Geo is in your cable guide.

MON / March 16

Roswell, New Mexico Drama 9p

Supernatural Drama 8p

The series moves to a new timeslot for its final few months, concluding with the series finale on May 18.

THU / April 2

How to Get Away With Murder Drama 10p

SUN / April 5

55th Academy of Country Music Awards Live event/Music 8p

Seven-part Masterpiece drama is set across five countries (England, France, Germany, Poland, and the United States) during WWII. Helen Hunt, Sean Bean, Lesley Manville, Blake Harrison, and Jonah Hauer-King head the cast.

WED / April 29

2020 Billboard Music Awards Live event/Music 8p

SUN / June 7

74th Annual Tony Awards Live event 8p

SUN / September 27

Impeachment: American Crime Story Drama tbd

The third season of Ryan Murphy's anthology is set during the later years of the Bill Clinton administration and focuses on the Monica Lewinsky scandal. The real-life Lewinsky serves as a producer and will be played in the series by Booksmart's Beanie Feldstein, while Clive Owen portrays Clinton, Sarah Paulson plays Linda Tripp, and Annaleigh Ashford is Paula Jones. Jeffrey Toobin's best-seller A Vast Conspiracy serves as the source material.

TUE / September 29

Presidential Debate Live event tbd, 9p ET

Vice Presidential Debate Live event tbd, 9p ET

THU / October 15

THU / October 22
title: 2019-20 Fall/Winter TV Premiere Calendar

meta_data.description: Find a calendar of premiere dates for all upcoming new and returning television shows, plus TV movies and specials.
